Title: Data Analyst
Description:
payabl. empowers businesses to grow through payments innovation and banking services. Our ambition is to expand our strong portfolio of global financial services we provide to business and make them all available in one place on our platform we call payabl.one.

As a licensed financial company with principal membership with card schemes, we specialize in global payments and providing businesses with multi-currency accounts. With offices located in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Limassol, and London, we are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. This role can be in one of our offices in Frankfurt, Limassol, Amsterdam, or London, it can also be remote anywhere in Europe.

This role is about:

The Data Analyst role is responsible for collecting, processing data of business information systems to discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision-making. Furthermore you will identify challenges and opportunities within the organization and provide solutions that help achieve the business' goals. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits. You will be a driving force in data systems development, backing up suggestions with evidence.

You will:


Analyse data, outlining challenges, opportunities and solutions based on the internal and external data
Filtering the data, handling missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance
Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyze data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends
Create visual representations of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make the data understandable at a glance
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the insights and findings from the data to stakeholders, which can influence policy and decision-making processes
Work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights



What we need:


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent at presenting data analysis insights to any type of audience in a clear and actionable way
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in everything you do
Experience working with senior decision makers
Conduct data analysis with Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy), SQL, Excel
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) and databases (PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Apache Druid)
Ability to automate data reports, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in data delivery
Familiarity with tools and software that enable scheduling and automatic generation of reports (e.g., cron jobs, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Power Automate)
Experience with Event Tracking, conceptualizing product events, and product analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Matomo, etc.)



The perks of being a payabler:


üöó Drive in Style: After your probation, a sleek company car is all yours.
Future-Proof Your Finances: Jump on board, and after your probation period, we'll kickstart your Provident Fund
üå± Grow Without Limits: Our environment is all about nurturing your talents and fueling your ambition with endless opportunities for professional development.
Speak Like a Local: Greek language classes, offered twice a week for all team members.
üí≥ Shop and Save: Get exclusive access to a discount card at various local businesses.
üåçThrive in a multicultural workplace that celebrates diversity and values your unique contributions. Here, every perspective is appreciated, and every voice is heard.
Lead the Charge in Pioneering Projects: Be at the forefront of innovation by playing a key role in groundbreaking projects.
üèù Max Out Your Downtime: With 25 days off plus public holidays, and an extra 10 days for when you're under the weather, we make sure you have ample time to relax, recharge, and return brighter.
üìö Support for Your Educational Aspirations: We're here to support your educational pursuits because we believe in investing in your growth.
üçî Wolt Your Way Through Lunch: Enjoy a Wolt lunch allowance of ‚Ç¨150 per month


Ready to Join Us?

Let's embark on a journey to redefine the landscape of payments together. We're not just offering a role; we're inviting you to be a part of something bigger. Join our team, and let's innovate, disrupt, and lead the future of payments. Together, we can make an impact that resonates. Welcome to the team!

If this role seems like a good match, please submit your resume all applications are treated with the strictest confidentiality. Please note that we may keep your CV for a period of one (1) year for future relevant job opportunities. For more information about how we process your data please see our privacy policy at https://www.payabl.com/privacy-policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My Financial Services client in Amsterdam are looking for a data analyst to join their growing team. They specialise in Mortgage advisory and are growing out their analytics capability, so are looking for an experienced profile who can help them make data-driven decisions




Responsibilities:

- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

-Perform detailed data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to insurance products, customer behavior, claims, and market conditions.

-Use statistical methods and tools to analyze large datasets and generate reports.







Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL skills

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of PowerBI is ideal but not required

‚Ä¢ Fluent Dutch-speaking

‚Ä¢ Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:

‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

‚Ä¢ Travel allowance

‚Ä¢ Hybrid working and flexible working hours

‚Ä¢ Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)




Feel free to reach out via george.rayner@vividresourcing.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Harness your analytical skills to enhance digital security and shape the future of online retail!




As a Data Analyst in this leading role within the e-commerce sector, you will perform essential security analyses for a top online retail platform.




Your focus will be on analyzing security data to identify potential risks and implement measures that enhance both safety and user experience.




Although this role is primarily remote, you are expected to be present at our office in Utrecht every Tuesday to collaborate and coordinate with the team.




What we are looking for




Hard Skills + Years of Experience: More than 5 years of experience in data analysis, specifically focused on security data.

Expertise in using analytical tools such as Big Query, Grafana, and Elastic Search is essential.

Other Experiences + Requirements: Proven experience in identifying security risks and proposing improvements based on data analysis.

Language: Excellent command of English is necessary, as this is the working language in the environment.




What we offer




Salary Package + Other Benefits / Rate: A competitive salary of ‚Ç¨5,200 - ‚Ç¨6,700 per month for a 40-hour work week, or an hourly rate of ‚Ç¨78 - ‚Ç¨92, depending on experience and qualifications.
Contract Type: This is a temporary assignment until the end of the year, with the possibility of extension.
Hybrid / Remote / Office: Primarily remote work with the option for occasional office visits.
Visa: Not applicable.
Relocation Opportunities: Not available.




Is this you? Please apply now!




Are you an experienced Data Analyst with a passion for improving digital security? Apply now!




For more information about this position, please contact us at gavindegraaf@live.nl

Title: BI-Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a BI and data visualization specialist who is passionate about data, enjoys creating visualizations, and can't go a day without developing an awesome dashboard or data mart.




We need someone who is ready to take responsibility for a pool of dashboards for the finance department ‚Äî developing a roadmap for data marts and dashboards, creating new dashboards and data marts, improving existing ones, and finding ways to enhance our business processes. Our tech stack includes Oracle NetSuite as the primary source, a variety of SaaS services as auxiliary sources, Oracle and PostgreSQL databases, and Tableau. This role involves collaborating directly with stakeholders and managing small projects.




What You Will Do:




Develop user-friendly and valuable management dashboards as part of the finance team.
Manage the pool of dashboards as a product: gather requirements, maintain a backlog of enhancements and ideas, and keep your dashboards and data organized.
Create simple ETL pipelines and manage SQL code.
Assist employees in self-service and improve their data literacy skills.




We Expect You:




Enjoy data visualization and finding the best ways to present data for business decision-making.
Have experience with Tableau, understand the tool's strengths and limitations, or have worked with other BI systems and are willing to master Tableau quickly.
Be proficient in SQL and capable of preparing data sources for dashboards.
Know when to use Python instead of SQL and have basic knowledge of the language.
Be able to communicate with stakeholders and gather task requirements.
Have the ability to double-check your work before publishing in a production environment.




It's a Plus If You:




Are passionate about data visualization or interface design, and enjoy books by Tufte, Few, or Norman.
Have a portfolio on Tableau Public
Have extensive experience with Oracle Analytical Warehouse or dbt.
Can work without detailed specifications or know how to collect them for dashboards used by a large number of users without a single client.
Have knowledge of RPA automation.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BI expert

Als BI expert help je bedrijven voor te bereiden op een data gedreven toekomst. Dit klinkt vast herkenbaar. Hieronder wat je gaat doen:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datamodellen, dashboards en rapportages.
Analyseren van bedrijfsdata om waardevolle inzichten te genereren.
Samenwerken met stakeholders om hun informatiebehoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar data-oplossingen.
Waarborgen van de integriteit, kwaliteit en veiligheid van data.
Optimaliseren van bestaande data-analyse processen en het implementeren van best practices.




Je hebt bij voorkeur meer dan 4 jaar ervaring als BI expert of data analist en weet daarom zelf wel welke tools en technieken belangrijk zijn om te beheersen. Wat wij belangrijker vinden, ben jij als persoon. Wij zoeken iemand die een fijne toevoeging is aan ons team. Dat betekent dat je op ten minste √©√©n van de onderstaande vragen ‚ÄòJA‚Äô kunt antwoorden.

Schud jij zo een grap uit je mouw?
Of lach jij snel om andermans flauwe grappen?
Houd je van intensief sporten of misschien nog beter; het drankje achteraf?
Vind jij eerlijkheid en transparantie belangrijk?
Zoek je betrokkenheid, maar wil je niet aan het lijntje gehouden worden?




Wat we je bieden

75% van jouw omzet (7 ‚Äì 11k per maand)
Een basissalaris van ‚Ç¨2750 per maand
Een vast contract na een twee maanden proeftijd
Vakantie wanneer jij wilt, een NS-Business Card en een persoonlijke pensioenregeling.
Een team waarin iedereen een data-expert is
Veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng
Elke maand een leuke activiteit
Gelijkwaardigheid, vertrouwen en waardering

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst at Diemen HQ, Netherlands. Hybrid. Fulltime.




people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees, and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today‚Äôs technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




how you will contribute

As a Senior Data Analyst at Randstad, you will leverage your excellent analytical skills and keen eye for detail to drive impactful data insights. In this role, you will go beyond the numbers to be the voice of data, effectively communicating with decision-makers, product owners, and team leaders.

You will thrive in our fast-paced corporate environment, adapting quickly to new challenges and finding pragmatic solutions. You will take ownership of your work, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all your analyses. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable insights will play a crucial role in guiding strategic decisions and driving the success of our initiatives.




what you will be doing

Within this role, via Randstad Market Insights (RMI), you will enable colleagues to make data driven decisions and conclusions by making data accessible and understandable. Behind the scenes you will set up and execute data analysis on a variety of internal and external data sources as well as build dashboards to generate actionable insights, keep track of the key data quality metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.




who will you work with

As part of the RMI team, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientists, a product owner, a scrum master, and junior data analysts based in the Global Competency Center (GCC). Additionally, you will work alongside a senior data engineer, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of data across various projects.

In this guiding role, you will mentor and support junior data analysts, fostering their growth and development within the team. Your responsibilities will involve working with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, translating these requirements into actionable insights, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data solutions.




what you will bring

Your communication, visualization, and storytelling skills are well-developed, allowing you to effectively translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives for various audiences. With a track record in data analysis, preferably within a market intelligence or similar corporate environment, you excel in collaborative settings and are an excellent team player.

You possess fluency in data visualization and business intelligence (BI) tools enabling you to create insightful and impactful visual representations of data as well as proficiency in SQL. Additionally, you have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), enhancing your ability to manage and analyze data in modern, scalable environments.

Your demonstrated ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.




what‚Äôs in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;

Hybrid work (based twice a week in Diemen HQ) with sporadic travel requirements
Competitive salary
An additional flexible benefit budget
Attractive bonus scheme
Option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan
Option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays
Attractive mobility arrangements
Opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave
Growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment
Working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed
An environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated




We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our Internal Talent Acquisition Partner Jenny Roberts (jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk)




The recruitment procedure consists of a screening, a 30 minute online behavioural assesment and at least two interviews.




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team

Behind the scenes you will set up and execute data analysis on a variety of internal and external data sources as well as build dashboards to generate actionable insights, keep track of the key data quality metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.

As part of the RMI team, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientists, a product owner, a scrum master, and junior data analysts based in the Global Competency Center (GCC). Additionally, you will work alongside a senior data engineer, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of data across various projects.

In this guiding role, you will mentor and support junior data analysts, fostering their growth and development within the team. Your responsibilities will involve working with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, translating these requirements into actionable insights, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data solutions.


what you will bring

Your communication, visualization, and storytelling skills are well-developed, allowing you to effectively translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives for various audiences. With a track record in data analysis, preferably within a market intelligence or similar corporate environment, you excel in collaborative settings and are an excellent team player.

You possess fluency in data visualization and business intelligence (BI) tools enabling you to create insightful and impactful visual representations of data as well as proficiency in SQL. Additionally, you have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), enhancing your ability to manage and analyze data in modern, scalable environments.

Your demonstrated ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.


what‚Äôs in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;

  • Hybrid work (based twice a week in Diemen HQ) with sporadic travel requirements
  • Competitive salary
  • An additional flexible benefit budget
  • Attractive bonus scheme
  • Option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan
  • Option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays
  • Attractive mobility arrangements
  • Opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave
  • Growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment
  • Working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed
  • An environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated


We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.


If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our Internal Talent Acquisition Partner Jenny Roberts (jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk)


The recruitment procedure consists of a screening, a 30 minute online behavioural assesment and at least two interviews.


We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
This is B&S

B&S exists to make premium consumer goods available to everyone, anywhere. We believe that getting access to consumer products that bring joy and comfort into everyday lives, should be easy around the globe.

We are proud to see B&S featured in the latest edition of the #MT500 by MT/Sprout, which lists the 500 most reputable companies in the Netherlands. We rank #9 most attractive employer and #6 most sustainable company.

Are you curious about who we are as an employer and our thoughts on diversity and inclusion? Click here to find more information!



Job Description



Are you ready to give your career a flying start? We are looking for a detail-oriented and organized Commercial Data Analyst with strong project management skills to join our team. This is your chance to fully develop your potential and play a crucial role in the enhancement of our procurement applications.

Reach your full potential as a Data Analyst

The first year is all about learning and growing. You will get to know our company, our suppliers, and our processes by working with the support team. This will give you a good understanding of how we handle our orders and how purchase orders are created. In addition, you will join all developments related to our procurement application.

Our current application is used extensively by our buyers, but we see room for improvement. This is where you come in. With support from the Manager and your new colleagues, you will bring new and existing projects to fruition, implement them with current users, and become a key-user for the procurement application. In addition, you collect and interpret information from these purchasing applications, such as quotes, supplier performance and other internal or external sources. In this role, you take charge of your own procurement and move within set frameworks, giving you the space to make decisions independently.

You measure your success by controlling the daily procurement processes, ensuring both quality and quantity. Based on existing deadlines and objectives for the projects, you try to complete them on time or inform the stakeholders of any delays.



Qualifications



This Is You

We are looking for a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills, capable of quickly and accurately processing and analyzing commercial data. The ideal candidate is system-oriented and able to understand and automate complex systems and processes to improve efficiency.

Attention to detail is a must and exceptional organizational skills are essential to ensure accuracy and quality of work. You are assertive in managing projects and effectively co-ordinate with stakeholders.

A bachelor's degree in a data-related field
Affinity for data visualization
Proficiency in using data analysis tools and software
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Organizational talent and a proactive work attitude


Additional Information



We offer you

A maximum salary of up to ‚Ç¨4500,- in line with your experience, plus a yearly fixed Christmas bonus and a performance dependent bonus
Initially, a one-year contract with the prospect of permanent employment
25 vacation days, with the possibility to purchase additional days
A travel allowance of up to 75 km on single trip travel when working at the office, or an allowance if you‚Äôre working remotely (from home)
The flexibility to work 1 day a week from home
A pension scheme where 2/3rd of the pension costs are paid by us
The possibility to take courses related to your growth ambitions and function
A coaching program focused on your mental health (non-binding)
Participation in group insurance such as disability insurance and survivor‚Äôs insurance
Free use of our company gym and possibility to purchase fresh meals at our company restaurant
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we‚Äôre facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Dutch Speaking | Freelance | NL - Hybrid Working




Only candidates who speak Dutch are eligible for this role.




Are you an experienced Data Analyst with extensive experience in SQL and complex queries? Do you have a strong track record of working with stakeholders?




Then this could be the ideal role for you!




Amoria Bond is currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst for one of our clients based in the Netherlands. In this role, you will primarily focus on working with complex queries, acting as a key link between business requirements and technology.




Skills and Experience:




SQL experience of 5 years plus is essential
Experience with querying is essential
Oracle (nice to have)
Experience with data management (nice to have)
Dutch language proficiency is essential




Are you the Data Specialist we are looking for? Send your CV and contact details to Kieran.Hyde@amoriabond.com, and I will contact you as soon as I can!




We will endeavor to respond to your application ASAP. However, due to high volumes of inquiries, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications. This can sometimes be the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. We apologize for this and assure you that we will keep your details and contact you in the future should any suitable positions arise.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

As a Data Analyst, you are part of the Data & BI team and will be responsible for transforming complex data into actionable insights by designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports. You make connections between data that is already present within different departments of our company (sales, HR, IT, installations). The main focus in this role will be to rebuild existing reports and consolidate them towards a single model. This will empower our organization to make informed decisions based on data-driven insights.

Your job


Reviewing report catalogs and data sources
Define a single model together with our Data Engineer
Rebuilding existing reports towards a single model
Identify process improvements, propose system modifications.
Audit data quality and define improvement plans.



We Offer

At Eneco eMobility, you come first. You are the driving force. We invest heavily in your personal and professional development ‚Äì because when you shine, we shine. Therefore, we offer our employees attractive conditions so you can stay energized while you keep your eyes on creating a better future.


Salary between ‚Ç¨3,882 - ‚Ç¨5,446 per month based on 40 hours.
An annual 5% development and vitality budget, including a sports allowance.
Access to Good Habitz development portal.
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days at home, 2 days in the office, and 1 day of your choice.
Home working allowance of ‚Ç¨32.50 per month.
OV free travel subscription (24/7 throughout the Netherlands). With your OV free card, you can also travel privately.
27 days of leave + option to purchase 5 extra days per year.
Working in the heart of Rotterdam, 3 minute walk from Rotterdam Central train station
Focus on adventure, balance, and fun.



Job requirements

Working at Eneco eMobility means working in an organization that seizes opportunities ‚Äì even if they are not readily available. What is certain now may be different tomorrow. You are given the space to experiment. That's why you clearly love adventure and like to put your hands on to the wheel to 'get the job done'. And although you can work independently, you also know that real impact is made together. In short:


3+ years of experience as BI Consultant / Data Analyst, or similar roles.
Experience with Power BI (or other reporting tooling)
Experience in rebuilding reports into a single model
Excellent communication skills
Knowledge of data governance principles, policies, and practice.
Experience with data visualization and UX
Bonus skill: Experience with data science (incl. programming)



Please apply with your resume and motivation letter explaining your experience, aligned with our requirements.

Title: Global BI & Analytics Internship
Description:
GLOBAL BI & ANALYTICS INTERNSHIP

AMSTERDAM, COTY HQ

At Coty, we are seeking a motivated Global BI & Analytics Intern to join our team. This internship is designed for students who are eager to dive into the world of data and analytics on a global scale. The ideal candidate has a strong passion for data, an analytical mindset, and a desire to contribute to the global adoption of analytics tools such as Power BI within the organization. As an intern, you will work with our Business Facing BI team at our Headquarters in Amsterdam-Zuid, the Netherlands. The internship will begin in September 2024.

About Coty

We‚Äôre Coty, one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, and skin and body care. Coty is the global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics. Coty‚Äôs products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. Coty and its brands are committed to a range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment.

About The Business Facing BI Team In Amsterdam

The Business Facing BI team plays a pivotal role in implementing a variety of business intelligence and data analytics solutions to enable data-driven decision-making globally. Despite our small size, we are a diverse team with bases in both Amsterdam and New York City. We are committed to continuous learning and the adoption of cutting-edge technologies in the data space, cultivating a dynamic work environment where innovation propels Coty‚Äôs success through insightful data analysis.

What We Offer

At Coty, we offer an exceptional opportunity for our Global BI & Analytics intern to gain hands-on experience specifically with Power BI in a vibrant and dynamic environment. This internship provides exposure to complex BI projects utilizing Power BI, enabling significant business transformations. The intern will receive direct mentorship from the Business Facing Power BI Manager, fostering both personal and professional growth. Additionally, you'll benefit from an inclusive, supportive work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation with Power BI at its core. This is a unique chance to deepen your expertise in a key BI tool and to network with global professionals, potentially opening doors for future opportunities within the industry.

Requirements


Student (Bachelor/Master), it is important that you remain enrolled with your university.
Demonstrated passion for data and an interest in specializing in Power BI.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency with numbers.
Familiarity with data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, and R is highly advantageous.
Keen eye for detail to ensure high-quality, aesthetically pleasing outputs.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


Period

This internship is full-time (40 hours per week), for a duration of 5-6 months and starts from August/September 2024. Remote working is possible up to 50% of your time, in alignment with your line manager. You will receive an internship allowance and NS Business Card if you do not have a student public transport card. The internship can be combined with a thesis but be aware that this will largely have to be done in your own time.

Interested?

At Coty, we believe in equality and inclusion for all, and stand together with those fighting for freedom, justice, and equal rights regardless of who you are or who you love.

Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you‚Äôre the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible ‚Äì we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Please send us your motivation letter together with your CV, stating your availability and for how long.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Dit is zijn wij.

MyParcel is een energiek, snelgroeiend bedrijf dat innovatieve online software ontwikkelt die het logistieke proces voor online ondernemers gemakkelijker maakt. Daarnaast helpen we onze klanten bij uiteenlopende logistieke en e-commerce gerelateerde vraagstukken, zodat zij weer door kunnen met waar ze goed in zijn: ondernemen. We houden het simpel. Maken het slim. Dit doen we samen. Wij zijn MyParcel en wij gaan beyond delivery. Meer weten over MyParcel? Klik hier. Wat je in ieder geval moet weten is dat de markt waarin wij ons bevinden dynamisch en continu in ontwikkeling is. Wij dus ook! Klinkt dat jou als muziek in de oren? Dan zoeken we jou.




De functie.

Als Data Analist heb je een centrale plek binnen MyParcel. Je zorgt ervoor dat alle afdelingen, ons management team en onze klanten voorzien worden van de juiste inzichten en rapportages. Je leert hierdoor het hele bedrijf kennen, van Finance tot Customer Service. Daarnaast vertaal je de beschikbare data naar waardevolle inzichten voor onze klanten.

Je hebt de beschikking over meer dan tien verschillende databronnen die allemaal zijn aangesloten op ons datawarehouse in Snowflake. Op basis hiervan maak je uitgebreide analyses. Vervolgens visualiseer je deze in de BI-tool Looker, om de verschillende afdelingen te adviseren en MyParcel datagedreven te laten functioneren.




Wat vragen wij van jou?

Je werkt met tientallen miljoenen datapunten.
Je maakt betekenisvolle rapportages met Looker.
Je beheert de dashboards voor onze 40.000 klanten in het platform met Luzmo.
Je bewaakt de datakwaliteit in Snowflake.
Je koppelt nieuwe databronnen door middel van Fivetran.
Je modelleert brondata door middel van SQL en dbt.
Je voert experimenten en analyses uit in Python.
Je denkt mee met verschillende afdelingen om problemen inzichtelijk te maken en processen te vergemakkelijken.




Profiel.

Je hebt een relevante opleiding afgerond en/of relevante werkervaring.
Je hebt kennis van SQL, kennis van dbt en Snowflake is een pr√©.
Je hebt interesse in e-commerce.
Je toont initiatief en vindt het leuk om ergens helemaal in te duiken.
Je hebt zin om in een team nieuwe inzichten te cre√´ren voor een snelgroeiend bedrijf.
Je bent 32 ‚Äì 40 uur per week beschikbaar.
Je bent op zoek naar een uitdagende werkomgeving.




Voldoe je niet aan alle functie-eisen, maar heb je andere ervaringen, kwaliteiten of competenties die jou zeker geschikt maken voor deze rol? Dan zien we jouw sollicitatie, waarin je ons daarvan overtuigt, alsnog graag tegemoet!




Wij groeien en jij groeit met ons mee.

We streven er continu naar de beste en meest persoonlijke service te bieden voor onze klanten in een professionele maar ongedwongen werksfeer, waarin we altijd openstaan voor nieuwe idee√´n. Benieuwd naar wat wij jou kunnen bieden?




We bieden een ambitieuze en ook leuke werkomgeving waar volop ruimte is voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Passend salaris en genoeg doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen ons functiehuis.
Mogelijkheid om (gedeeltelijk) thuis te werken.
25 vakantiedagen per jaar.
Baan voor 32-40 uur per week.
Kans op een eindejaarsgratificatie o.b.v. onze doelstellingen.
Je hebt verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden.
Een NS-Business Card die al jouw reiskosten dekt.
Elke dag vers fruit en een lekkere lunch.
Macbook van de zaak.




Werken als Data Analist in Hoofddorp?

Stuur direct je CV en motivatie naar vacatures@myparcel.nl onder vermelding van de functietitel. Voor eventuele vragen over de functie en de procedure kun je mailen naar vacatures@myparcel.nl.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data analist

Als Data analist (speaking dutch fluently) bij Ordina Sopra steria werk je aan gave uitdagende projecten in een divers team van collega-data analisten. Sla je de brug tussen de business, informatie en techniek. Jouw expertise en ambities vormen de basis voor onze High-Performance Teams (HPT's), waarin samenwerking en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan. Iedereen draagt bij vanuit zijn eigen vakmanschap en technologie. Zo blijf je van elkaar leren en sta je er dus nooit alleen voor.




Werken als Data analist bij Ordina Sopra steria

Je voert gesprekken als materie deskundige met stakeholders als beheerders, gebruikers en architecten.
Je brengt behoeften van stakeholders in kaart en vertaalt deze naar informatie oplossingen.
Je stelt gevalideerde requirements en specificaties op met de juiste kwaliteit en diepgang en prioriteert deze met de business.
Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de organisatie en de scrumteams voor de inhoud en je bent als geen andere in staat om duidelijk over te brengen wat er gerealiseerd moet worden.




Waar jij komt te werken

Binnen de area Data cre√´ren wij duurzame waarde bij onze klanten op het gebied van data. Wij helpen bedrijven om wendbaar te blijven in de transitie door data en techniek onderdeel te laten zijn van zowel de dagelijkse operatie als ook de strategische besluitvorming. Hiermee helpen wij onze klanten de verandering voor te zijn met behulp van data. Het is onze ambitie om organisaties te laten excelleren met data. Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met focus op kennis en innovatie, een open no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor eigen initiatief.




De area bestaat uit 5 practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualisation, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations en Spatial Intelligence. Elk met een duidelijke signatuur en focus op inhoud en bijbehorende solution. Binnen deze area zijn ruim 170 professionals werkzaam in een voor hun logische en passende vakinhoudelijke practice.




Dit ben jij

Jij bent een enthousiaste en ondernemende professional die initiatief neemt en graag bijdraagt aan een collegiale werkomgeving. Je waardeert kennisdeling en samenwerking, en bent in staat om jouw idee√´n en inzichten te delen met collega's. Met een proactieve houding ben je gemotiveerd om samen met anderen innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen. In onze organisatie krijg je de ruimte om je ondernemerschap te tonen en bij te dragen aan een cultuur waarin teamwork en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan.




Verder neem je mee:

Afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding
Tenminste 2 jaar ervaring met data-analyses en data-ontwerp
Affiniteit met data, datastructuren en datamapping
Kennis en ervaring met datamodelleren, relationele algebra en SQL
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal




Waarom Ordina Sopra steria?

Naast uitdagende werkmogelijkheden, een open werkcultuur en leuke collega‚Äôs, bieden wij jou ook de vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je professionele doelen te behalen door een ruim aanbod aan trainingen aan te bieden. Daarnaast bieden wij ook de volgende andere punten:

Een vast contract
Basis salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨4000 en ‚Ç¨6500 o.b.v. 40 uur
Flexibele werkomgeving waar je zelfstandig tijd en plaats kunt bepalen
Mobiliteitsbudget met keuze voor een leaseauto of eigen vervoer
Flex benefit budget en collectieve regelingen
Keuze uit een MacBook Pro (inc Apple accessoires) of Windows laptop
Een betrokken community gericht op teambuilding, gaming en evenementen




Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Wij geloven namelijk in de kracht van diversiteit en waarderen inclusie. De beste idee√´n en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Daarom besteden we veel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high-performance teams. Zodat jij je thuis voelt en het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.




Ben je klaar om je carri√®re een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Data analist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.

Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.






Job Description



Who will you be working with?
The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.

What you are going to do
As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia Partners, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.

Responsibilities include:

Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are

You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need

Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer

Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast with experience in digital marketing or payments analytics? Can you skillfully manage multiple business stakeholders to achieve their goals? Do you thrive on communicating with diverse teams and transforming their requirements into impactful data solutions?

If this sounds like you, then a role as a Data Analyst at Creative Clicks could be your next exciting career move! Join our dynamic team and make a real difference with your data-driven insights. Apply now and let's create something amazing together!




We are Creative Clicks

Creative Clicks is the world's leading data-driven marketing platform for mobile and beyond. We empower brands, publishers, and marketers to attract and engage global customers at scale through our proprietary machine learning technology. Our KPI-driven mobile marketing solutions include social and search, video, native, and display advertising, delivered at a massive scale via our robust network of 36,000 partners.

At Creative Clicks, data is the fuel that drives our campaigns, powered by insights. Our proprietary machine learning and tracking technology ensures automatic optimization of your campaigns. Additionally, our team leverages insights from audience, user, and campaign data, gathered from thousands of campaigns since our founding in 2009. Join us to experience the power of cutting-edge technology and unparalleled expertise in digital marketing.




About the team:

As a Data Analyst in the Analytics & Commercial Insights team, you will collaborate with two other data analysts, a business analyst, a data scientist, and the team lead. Our team supports various business development teams for our in-house products on all data-related matters. We work closely with the Data Engineering team, Project Managers, Product Owners, and Software Developers to uncover new data insights, analyze KPIs, and create data models that provide new optimization opportunities for the business. Our daily focus includes analyzing digital campaign performance on platforms like Google and Facebook, optimizing conversion rates, studying customer churn and lifetime value, conducting pricing and product analysis, detecting fraud, and optimizing payment flows.




Job responsibilities:

Design KPIs and measurable metrics according to the different stakeholders and product needs.
Build dashboards and reports around growth initiatives and business priorities.
Manage the relationship with key stakeholders in order to gather and guide reporting and analytical requirements.
Understand and find the best solutions for stakeholders' questions related to different business projects and divisions based on data insights (user behaviour, payment performance, fraud detection, customer churn and lifetime value, etc.).
Proactively translate the results from your analysis to actionable points that help stakeholders take the correct approach to improve their business.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams with different expertise, including Operations, Product, Payments, Marketing and Finance.
Be responsible for the long-term data quality of the solutions implemented.




Job requirements




Who are you?

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
2+ years of relevant work experience. Experience with digital payment flows, performance marketing, or mobile app funnels is a plus.
Business stakeholder-oriented.
A curious individual motivated by solving data challenges, understanding customer behavior, and exploring the complexity of digital payment data.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex concepts to stakeholders clearly and concisely.
Capable of proposing and building innovative solutions, as well as testing and ensuring the quality of your analyses and implementations.




Required experience with:

Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong technical experience with relational databases and SQL.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud services.
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Project management skills.
Knowledge of DAX and Power Query is a plus.




We offer:

A highly dynamic and fast ‚Äì growing working environment.
An international company with more than 25 different nationalities.
Competitive salary and fully paid commuting expenses.
Unlimited access to OpenUp (Certified Psychologists) .
25 days of annual leave (and the opportunity to buy out 10 more) with a healthy work-life balance and a hybrid work set up.
A place to learn discover and develop yourself.
Healthy daily lunch in the office.
Fun and ambitious young team of colleagues and a recently renovated beautiful office only 2 minutes from Leidseplein in in Amsterdam.







Creative Clicks is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

Our daily focus includes analyzing digital campaign performance on platforms like Google and Facebook, optimizing conversion rates, studying customer churn and lifetime value, conducting pricing and product analysis, detecting fraud, and optimizing payment flows.


Job responsibilities:

  • Design KPIs and measurable metrics according to the different stakeholders and product needs.
  • Build dashboards and reports around growth initiatives and business priorities.
  • Manage the relationship with key stakeholders in order to gather and guide reporting and analytical requirements.
  • Understand and find the best solutions for stakeholders' questions related to different business projects and divisions based on data insights (user behaviour, payment performance, fraud detection, customer churn and lifetime value, etc.).
  • Proactively translate the results from your analysis to actionable points that help stakeholders take the correct approach to improve their business.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams with different expertise, including Operations, Product, Payments, Marketing and Finance.
  • Be responsible for the long-term data quality of the solutions implemented.


Job requirements


Who are you?

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of relevant work experience. Experience with digital payment flows, performance marketing, or mobile app funnels is a plus.
  • Business stakeholder-oriented.
  • A curious individual motivated by solving data challenges, understanding customer behavior, and exploring the complexity of digital payment data.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex concepts to stakeholders clearly and concisely.
  • Capable of proposing and building innovative solutions, as well as testing and ensuring the quality of your analyses and implementations.


Required experience with:

  • Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
  • Strong technical experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud services.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment.
  • Project management skills.
  • Knowledge of DAX and Power Query is a plus.


We offer:

  • A highly dynamic and fast ‚Äì growing working environment.
  • An international company with more than 25 different nationalities.
  • Competitive salary and fully paid commuting expenses.
  • Unlimited access to OpenUp (Certified Psychologists) .
  • 25 days of annual leave (and the opportunity to buy out 10 more) with a healthy work-life balance and a hybrid work set up.
  • A place to learn discover and develop yourself.
  • Healthy daily lunch in the office.
  • Fun and ambitious young team of colleagues and a recently renovated beautiful office only 2 minutes from Leidseplein in in Amsterdam.



Creative Clicks is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
We are excited to be named one of the World‚Äôs Best Workplaces by Fortune Magazine!

About Us

Stryker is one of the world‚Äôs top medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people live more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst Intern in Stryker, you will be immersed in analysing various datapoints to help Stryker deliver its growth strategy in Europe. Together with the Analytics team you will create scalable, investigative capabilities which enable the Division commercial teams to reduce time spent on data searching, cleaning, reporting and shift focus towards running the business with supporting facts, insights, and foresights. This role is perfect for highly analytically minded individuals looking to impact healthcare through technology. This hands-on internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute to create a data culture in Stryker and gain valuable industry experience.

Opportunities & Benefits That The Role Offers


Opportunity to work on fulfilling and future focused projects, which will contribute to our continued commercial success within the division.
This position offers excellent opportunities of personal development including stakeholder management within an international medical device company, working together with both functional stakeholders, COE team-members and Divisional senior management.
Help shape the future of the COE Analytics team in Europe, to ensure the team provide best in class service to our commercial divisions.
Work in Europe‚Äôs 6th best ‚ÄúGreat Place to Work‚Äù.


What will you do at Stryker?


Translate stakeholder requirements to potential data analytics
Generate competitive and actionable insights by analyzing sales and product data
Conduct analysis for various markets and divisions, from problem and requirements definition to code validation and deployment.
Support in the creation of scalable and efficient data capabilities (incl. external data sources)
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales operation analyst, commercial analysts and BI analysts to support insight generation
Build and improve SQL queries, Power BI dashboards and automate processes that will gear the reporting and insights capabilities.
Help in the preparation of reports and presentations that communicate research findings and marketing insights to internal stakeholders.


Is this you?


Currently pursuing a master's or bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Statistics/Mathematics/Economics, Business Administration or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and an ability to interpret data to derive meaningful insights.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficient in English
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently.
You have knowledge in Data governance concepts including the need for documented definitions, calculations, sources, lineage, etc.
Experienced in at least one of the tools central to data analytics: SQL, Python, Power BI, DAX


You love a Challenge A self-starter who enjoys problem solving and creating innovative solutions.

You Build Relationships You build and maintain successful relationships with key internal and external stakeholders and customers.

You do the Right Thing You have a high level of integrity, responsibility, discipline, and attention to detail. You understand the importance of keeping tabs of what is always going on in your goals/projects.

Additional Information

Type of contract: Internship

Location: Amsterdam

Start date: September 1st

Duration: 6 Months or more

Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analist Digital
Description:
Op het hoofdkantoor

Bij Albert Heijn werken is niet zomaar een baan. Het is werk met betekenis. Je werkt in een informele cultuur samen met een bevlogen team dat graag voorop wil blijven lopen en verschil wil maken. Met jouw unieke talent maak je impact op het leven van al onze klanten. Je leert van experts in hun vakgebied en we helpen je jouw loopbaan vorm te geven. Je kunt bij ons flexibel werken, zowel vanuit huis als op ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Een baan bij Albert Heijn is niet alleen een baan voor nu, maar ook voor later

Wat betekent dit voor jou?

Wij maken van Albert Heijn het beste omnichannel Food & Tech bedrijf en willen digitaal gemak voor iedereen. We testen en experimenteren, zijn innovatief en verleggen grenzen. Voor die reis hebben wij het Data Talent Track. Een track waarin wij jouw carri√®re als Data Analyst bij Albert Heijn een vliegende start geven binnen onze Digital Analytics afdeling. Is dit echt iets voor jou? Word dan de nieuwe Data Analyst in ons Data Talent Track!

Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek

Als Data Analyst ken jij onze klant het beste. Deze kennis verkrijg je door gebruik te maken van data (zoals bijvoorbeeld data over koopgedrag), om zo de performance van de business te verhogen. Tijdens het aandragen en ontwikkelen van data-oplossingen breng je zowel creativiteit als pragmatisme mee en werk met de nieuwste data analytics technieken. Je maakt onderdeel uit van het Digital Analytics & Data Science team, en bent daarmee onderdeel van de grotere Analytics community binnen Albert Heijn. Je beweegt makkelijk tussen Tech, Data Science en de business teams, waarbij je enerzijds meedenkt op strategisch en tactisch niveau en anderzijds verantwoordelijk bent voor het bouwen en implementeren van verschillende data analytics toepassingen. Je maakt impact als Data Analist door:


Onze omnichannel strategie proactief te vertalen in data gedreven advies
Het analyseren van verschillende typen data (zoals transactiedata, klant- en marktdata) om van daaruit scherpe inzichten te formuleren over onze klanten, onze concurrenten en de markt op basis waarvan we de juiste acties kunnen ondernemen om onze business doelen te behalen
Het introduceren van nieuwe analyse methodes en modellen
Creatief op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe inzichten door gebruik te maken van (nieuwe) databronnen
Data inzichten te vertalen naar experimenten voor innovatieve toepassingen, denk hierbij bijvoorbeeld aan oplossingen om een relevantere klantreis aan te bieden binnen onze Digitale kanalen
Het hebben van een pragmatische doch onderbouwde aanpak, een simpele oplossing is vaak beter dan een complexe. Het gaat om de impact, niet om het model
De verschillende stakeholders mee te nemen: van data analyses naar bruikbare inzichten



Dit doe je als Data Analyst Digital

Het Digital domein richt zich op digitale relevantie, experimentation, eCommerce en klantloyaliteit. Hiervoor voeren we data-analyses uit of ontwikkelen wij dataproducten om onze e-commerce en Digital-afdelingen te ondersteunen met inzichten rondom onze klanten, het verbeteren van e-commerce en het verbeteren van de customer journey. Denk daarbij aan projecten zoals het relevanter maken van onze aanbiedingen (Mijn Bonus Box) of marketing, inzichtelijk maken van de omnichannel customer journeys en het analyseren van onze spaarprogramma‚Äôs.

Jouw ontwikkeling in het Data Talent Track

Het Data Talent Track is een anderhalf jaar durend programma vol met soft- en hard skills trainingen die je helpen om jouw professionele vaardigheden te ontwikkelen. Zo zijn er trainingen zoals persoonlijk leiderschap en het effici√´nter schrijven van code, maar ga je bijvoorbeeld ook een dagje meehelpen in de winkel of bouw je mee aan de idee√´n van de toekomst in een Hackathon. Wil je meer weten over hoe het Data Talent Track eruitziet? Neem dan vooral ook eens een kijkje hier.

Dit breng je mee

Als grootste supermarkt van Nederland vullen we met meer dan 100.000 medewerkers dagelijks zo'n 5 miljoen borden. En als het aan ons ligt, doen we dat binnenkort ook samen met jou als onze Data Analyst. Zeker als je de broodnodige pro-activiteit en resultaatgerichtheid naar Albert Heijn meebrengt. Jij bent gedreven, staat sterk in je schoen en de ambitie spat van je af. Ook heb je:


Een afgeronde wo-opleiding met data- en/of statistische basis zoals Econometrie, Operations Research, Wiskunde, Informatica, Business Analytics of Marketing Intelligence
Ervaring met werken met grote databases (Python / PySpark / R / SQL)
Ervaring met het oplossen van business vraagstukken met data analytics en/of Data Science technieken d.m.v. Python / R
Ervaring met visualisatie tools zoals Tableau of Power BI is een pr√©



En, niet onbelangrijk, ben je:


Proactief; je geeft zowel gevraagd als ongevraagd advies
Sterk in het adviseren van de business en meenemen van stakeholders
Communicatief sterk; je weet complexe informatie aan een niet-technisch publiek uit te leggen‚ÄØ



De beste ingredi√´nten voor een betekenisvolle baan


Een salaris van max ‚Ç¨ 4000,- per periode van 4 weken (afhankelijk van je ervaring)
Een winstuitkering oplopend van 45 tot 130% van je gemiddelde periodesalaris
We sparen samen voor een heel goed pensioen. En wij betalen ruim 5 keer zo veel als jij. Zo ben je ook later verzekerd van een goed inkomen üôÇ
Je kunt 45 (ja, vijfenveertig) dagen vrij nemen; 25,5 vaste vakantiedagen en 19,5 ADV dagen. Veel plezier!
Je ontwikkelt je even snel als de tech waar we mee werken. Dankzij feedback loops met de best & the brightest tech savvy collega‚Äôs. En door actief bij te dragen aan de AH Technology community ‚Äì plons in een zee aan kennis en inzichten!
Een moderne laptop en smartphone zijn ‚Äòinbegrepen‚Äô. Bovendien hamster je kortingen. Op verzekeringen en je boodschappen bijvoorbeeld
Je neemt deel aan het Data Talent track, een anderhalf jaar durend programma vol met soft- en hard skills trainingen, en daarnaast heb je ook toegang tot onze AH Data Academy met nog veel meer trainingen zowel op hard- als soft skills. Jou een vliegende kickstart geven en de kans om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen vinden wij namelijk erg belangrijk
Een werkgever die het beste van twee werelden combineert: de kansen die je met een corporate associeert plus de autonomie en de ‚Äúto boldly go where no person has gone before‚Äù drive die scale-ups kenmerkt
De kans om miljoenen mensen gezonder, lekkerder en makkelijker te laten eten



Solliciteer

Klik op de sollicitatiebutton en ontdek hoe je dat, samen met enorm diverse √©n enorm enthousiaste collega‚Äôs, werkelijkheid maakt. We willen je daarbij vragen om geen standaard motivatiebrief te sturen, maar een antwoord te formuleren op de volgende vragen:


Waarom zou je bij Albert Heijn willen werken?
Waarom zou je graag bij Digital Analytics willen werken?
Waarom denk jij dat je succesvol gaat zijn in deze functie? Vermijd woorden die in deze vacaturetekst staan en houd het persoonlijk
Als je √©√©n sterk en √©√©n persoonlijk verbeterpunt mag noemen, welke zouden dit dan zijn?
Welke programmeer ervaring (Python, SQL, R, etc.) heb je al?



Meer weten?

Voor inhoudelijke vragen kun je contact opnemen met Peter Dirks (Talent Acquisition Partner Data) via peter.dirks@ah.nl.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Lead
Description:
PowerBI Lead / PowerBI Product Lead / PowerBI Architect




We are searching for a PowerBI Lead for a well known bank in the Hague. They are in the process of transforming the business into a digital organization with data at the heart of their decision making process.




PowerBI is a core part of this. They are searching for a PowerBI Lead who can guide the stakeholders into leveraging BI to optimize their functions.




Location: The Hague

Hybrid remote: 2 / 3 times a week office

Department: Advanced Analytics Centre of Expertise

Permanent role




Your responsibilities

You are the person setting up and implementing the PowerBi tool, setting up guidelines, processes, uniform way of working, governance, policies, documentation
You think about the architectural components and how to implement them
You have experience working overarching several departments and capabilities, you have a holistic viewpoint of implementation




Your profile:

You are strong in PowerBi and believe in the value of the tool + dashboarding
You have experience in influencing stakeholders and implementing change/new way of working within an organization
You might have the following background/experience: led implementation of PowerBi tool in another organization, you are a PowerBi Architect, PowerBi Product Owner, PowerBI Lead, Head of PowerBI/Business Intelligence
You are social and a great communicator




The bank offers great benefits:

32 holidays
Hyrid working from The Hague office
Best pension in the Netherlands (+30% of annual salary)
Excellent Learning & Development programs
NS Business card 1st Class
Powerful challenger bank with, great position in NL and Sustainability to its core




If you're interested, please apply now!

Show more

  • Powerful challenger bank with, great position in NL and Sustainability to its core


If you're interested, please apply now!

Title: Data Analyst (Credit Risk Models)
Description:
Data Analyst (Credit Risk Models)




As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Financial Client, I am seeking for a Data Analyst (Credit Risk Models) for a position in Utrecht, Netherlands. The successful candidate will be working within the Data Domain, you will be working on projects mainly focused on Credit Modelling and will collaborate a lot with different colleagues in the Tribe Data Factory and Tribe Credit Analytics.




Top 4 responsibilities

Analysis and determination of the scope of data to be archived to Modeldata-HiSDA (Highly Secured Data Archive) of a decomissioned system.
Analysis and determination of the scope of sources from GDP to Modeldata- HiSDA. Due to GDPR retention.
Reasoning from the mandate for HiSDA and data products in these analyses.
Guiding the team on how to store data so it can be used for Credit Modelling.




Practical Examples

Source Data for Credit Risk Models
Historical Datasets of 20 years.
Analysing Databases.




Core Requirement:

You have a Master degree in a quantitative field or IT, or Finance/Economics.
You have at least 5 year relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector.
You have strong analytical and conceptual skills and you have gained experience in working with large volumes of data in complex -data structures (un-transparent, low quality). MS SQL code is a must have, some Python is helpful too.
Banking knowledge is preferred, especially of credit risk, financial markets and corporate banking products and processes, and how this is translated into data flows.
Strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written




Contract: 12+ month

Rates: Excellent

Location: Utrecht

Interview: 2 stages




Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: NGS Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: NGS Data Analyst

Location: Utrecht (Hybrid working possible)

Type: 6-Month Contract (with possibility of extension)

Hours: 32-40 hours per week

Start Date: ASAP




Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled NGS Data Analyst to join our biotech client in Utrecht. This is a 6-month contract position with the possibility of extension, offering 32-40 hours per week and the flexibility of hybrid working.




As a NGS Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in the company. Your primary responsibilities will include analyzing and reporting NGS data prepared by the lab members, and writing comprehensive reports based on your analyses. You will also review reports prepared by other Data Analysts. As they continue to innovate, your role will expand to include new in-house developed techniques and a broader portfolio of analyses.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and report on generated NGS data.
Write detailed, accurate reports based on data analysis.
Review reports written by other Data Analysts.
Contribute to team activities and project turnover.
Ensure compliance with GMP standards in all reporting and analysis.




Requirements:

PhD in Molecular Biology or equivalent (preferred)
Experience in genetic analysis, particularly NGS data and/or knowledge of working with IGV.
Customer-oriented mindset and ability to thrive in a commercial setting.
Fluency in English.
Flexible, self-driven team player with a pragmatic attitude.
Commitment to quality, accuracy, and continuous learning.




If you are a dedicated professional with a passion for genetic analysis and a commitment to quality, we encourage you to apply here or send your resume to o.rath@progressive-nl.com.
