Title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Fraud & Data Analyst to The Fraud Strategy & Analytics Team
Description:
About Entercard

Entercard is one of Scandinavia‚Äôs leading credit market companies with over 1.7 million customers across Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland. We are dedicated to providing innovative and secure financial solutions, and our commitment to integrity, transparency, and customer satisfaction is unwavering. At Entercard, we believe in fostering a collaborative environment where every team member can grow and make a significant impact.

Job Description

The Fraud Strategy & Analytics team consists of four analysts who own the Entercard Group‚Äôs short- and long-term fraud strategy. As a Analyst, you will have a broad strategic mandate to mitigate 1st and 3rd party fraud in the credit card and consumer loan segments. Additionally, you will help set budgets and forecasts, perform continuous risk assessments, and manage strategies and rules. In this dynamic position, you will:


Contribute to the construction of short- and long-term fraud prevention strategies.
Find, analyze, and investigate patterns related to card and application fraud.
Propose solutions that mitigate the company‚Äôs fraud exposure based on your analyses.
Develop strategic rules and track their performance over time.


The ideal candidate has a strong background in data analysis, with a particular focus on fraud detection and prevention. As a Fraud & Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our customers and business from fraudulent activities by leveraging advanced data analytics and developing effective strategies.

Profile

We Believe The Right Candidate For This Position Has


A relevant education and 5+ years of experience in fraud detection, data analysis, or a similar role within the financial services industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages like SQL, Python or similar is required.


You should be open-minded, creative, enjoy problem-solving, and be eager to learn about fraud. To succeed in this position, you need to have an analytical mindset, be curious about new ideas, embrace change as a part of your daily work, and have strong verbal skills and the ability to present ideas effectively. Our corporate language is English, and you need to be fluent in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Swedish/Norwegian/Danish) would be beneficial but is not required.

In this recruitment, Entercard is collaborating with Blaq Executive Search AB. If this position sounds interesting and aligns with your experiences and competencies, please contact Henrik Flood at 0739-830500 or *protected email*.
Show more
HTML:
About Entercard

Entercard is one of Scandinavia‚Äôs leading credit market companies with over 1.7 million customers across Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland. We are dedicated to providing innovative and secure financial solutions, and our commitment to integrity, transparency, and customer satisfaction is unwavering. At Entercard, we believe in fostering a collaborative environment where every team member can grow and make a significant impact.

Job Description

The Fraud Strategy & Analytics team consists of four analysts who own the Entercard Group‚Äôs short- and long-term fraud strategy. As a Analyst, you will have a broad strategic mandate to mitigate 1st and 3rd party fraud in the credit card and consumer loan segments. Additionally, you will help set budgets and forecasts, perform continuous risk assessments, and manage strategies and rules. In this dynamic position, you will:

  • Contribute to the construction of short- and long-term fraud prevention strategies.
  • Find, analyze, and investigate patterns related to card and application fraud.
  • Propose solutions that mitigate the company‚Äôs fraud exposure based on your analyses.
  • Develop strategic rules and track their performance over time.

The ideal candidate has a strong background in data analysis, with a particular focus on fraud detection and prevention. As a Fraud & Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our customers and business from fraudulent activities by leveraging advanced data analytics and developing effective strategies.

Profile

We Believe The Right Candidate For This Position Has

  • A relevant education and 5+ years of experience in fraud detection, data analysis, or a similar role within the financial services industry.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages like SQL, Python or similar is required.

You should be open-minded, creative, enjoy problem-solving, and be eager to learn about fraud. To succeed in this position, you need to have an analytical mindset, be curious about new ideas, embrace change as a part of your daily work, and have strong verbal skills and the ability to present ideas effectively. Our corporate language is English, and you need to be fluent in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Swedish/Norwegian/Danish) would be beneficial but is not required.

In this recruitment, Entercard is collaborating with Blaq Executive Search AB. If this position sounds interesting and aligns with your experiences and competencies, please contact Henrik Flood at 0739-830500 or *protected email*.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Experienced Analyst With Interest In CRM And Data-driven Personalization

Insurance is all about life. And it is all about data. At If we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data, analytics, and customer experience to help understand our customers even better.

About The Role

In this role you will be working in a cross-functional agile team, increasing insights, and contributing to creating the best insurance solutions and experiences for our customers. This will be done through providing insights on customer life-events affecting customers‚Äô insurance needs, supporting with reporting and analysis regarding activities, customer base development, and customer satisfaction and more.

We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. To enable your work, you will have access to flexible and robust data platforms both for analytics and visualization. And to help you in your quest for insight you will for cheered for, and supported by, 50+ data professionals in a Nordic Data and Analytics unit.

We offer

In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An including work environment where everyone is welcome
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
Possibility of hybrid workplace
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
Great insurance benefits



Who are you?

We think that you have a general interest in analytics and customers. You have strong technology and analytics skills. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand our customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics and have a positive, sharing, and proactive mindset. We also believe that you are excellent at communicating insights to stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.

Key Responsibilities Include


Creating actionable insights from large volumes of data.
Building visualizations to support business in understanding performance and identify areas of improvement.
Connecting data and insights to strategies to improve the customer journey.
Utilize relevant data to support personalized experiences to individual customers.
Proactively identifying new opportunities within data and analytics.
Supporting users in their understanding of data & analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with users.



Your Background


Excellent in data transformation and programming (e.g., SQL, Python).
Data visualization experience from BI tools such as Tableau or Microsoft Power BI.
You have a good understanding of CDPs and related technologies.
Hands-on experience with a CDP is a plus.
Experience from data driven CRM teams or CRM analytics is a plus.
Relevant university degree.
Fluent in English, understanding one or more of the Nordic languages



Additional Facts

Application deadline: Last date to apply is 25th of August 2024 ‚Äì application review will start immediately so don‚Äôt wait with sending in your application. All applications will go through our recruitment system.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. You don‚Äôt need to write a cover letter, instead please answer the questions that come up when you are applying.
Work location: Sweden (G√∂teborg/Stockholm) or Finland (Espoo/Turku)
Travelling: Some travelling is required.
Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to the country chapter lead:

For Sweden contact Kenny Karlsson at kenny.karlsson@if.se

For Finland contact Kirsi Rastas at kirsi.rastas@if.se

About Us

We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it ‚Äì because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers‚Äô side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn‚Äôt matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!

Title: Commercial Business Intelligence Analyst (Northern Europe)
Description:
Qatar Airways (QR) are recruiting for the role of Commercial Business Intelligence (CBI) Analyst.

Based in Stockholm you will be responsible for support of the Northern Europe Region. (Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, Poland, Russia)

You will add immediate value by supporting revenue performance within specific demand segments focusing on analysing traffic segments, distribution channels and travel agencies to drive QR market share and revenue goals.

You will be actively involved in providing recommendations on improvement initiatives.

Specific Accountabilities Include


Analysing traffic segments, distribution channels and travel agencies to drive QR market share and revenue goals.
Execute tactics to drive near term demand.
Execute and measure structural strategies eg: agency incentives
Slice revenue and market data to identify improvement opportunities for campaigns, structural fare products and incentive programs.
Collaborate with Sales and Marketing teams to drive tactical and structural initiatives.
Communicate with local offices and head office in delivering initiatives.
Structure and execute end-to-end campaigning initiatives and business cases; maintain campaign calendars.
Identify market opportunities through internal and external analysis and define actions to generate incremental revenue.
Review market trends and define mitigating and/or stimulating actions if performance deteriorations are identified.
Provide analyst commentary on portfolio, market and route performance
Identify business trends using real data, compile analysis reports that are delivered to senior management; calibrate those where necessary.


Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or Equivalent


Relevant experience ideally within Aviation or the travel industry managing (Processing and analysing) voluminous data
Solid experience in deriving insights from data and submitting actionable recommendations to management
PC literate with advanced knowledge of Word / Powerpoint / Excel / Outlook
You must also have the current legal right to live and work in Sweden to be considered for this role.

Title: Consultant - Data & Process Analytics
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

We're Celonis, the global leading Process Mining software company and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us as Consultant.

The Role:

As a Consultant in our delivery organization, you are part of our agile project teams to accelerate our customers‚Äô digital transformation and drive Celonis‚Äô international expansion. To generate high-value use cases, you work closely with our customers. You perform data transformations, develop analyses and derive business cases. You develop data-driven process insights and actions. You implement the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.

The work you‚Äôll do:


Initiate:
Play a key role in the Celonis implementation project to ensure the optimal solution to tackle the customer‚Äôs pain points
Design innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customer‚Äôs processes transparent
Use our Celonis technology to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes, always in close collaboration with the customer

Implement:


Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
Quantify the business and financial potential and present the findings to the management
Implement our Process Automation technology to speed up the customer‚Äôs processes, to drive value and to improve the process conformance rate


Adopt:


Implement the most relevant KPIs measuring the customer‚Äôs success
Ensure the enablement of the customer to continuously improve processes
Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen


The qualifications you need:


Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
You are knowledgeable of data related languages (SQL required, other programming languages such as Python are a plus...)
Strong communication skills in Swedish/Danish and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner
You search for a job with a steep learning curve in order to think outside the box and to continuously broaden your knowledge
Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program


What Celonis can offer you:


The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


About Us

Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
Show more

Title: Consumer Insight Specialist
Description:
We are looking for you, with a strong interest in trend monitoring, analysis and with a business drive, who wants to take on the position of Consumer Insight Specialist within the Nordic commercial team in Stockholm. If you also have experience of describing what drives the consumer demand and are used to conducting surveys, then this is the role for you!

As Consumer Insight Analyst, you have a good ability to transform data into guiding consumer insights. You are a specialist in your field but enjoy collaborating with different interfaces and constellations. You are curious and interested in understanding consumers and the world around you. You are a good listener but also have the ability to take your own initiatives and push forward within your areas of responsibility. You like to familiarize yourself with complex contexts and with an open mind find solutions. You have a high analytical ability and like to convey insights and enthuse in a credible way. With responsibility for handling and updating consumer and customer data, you take care of the internal reporting to the organization. Furthermore, you support the Nordic organization with ad hoc analyzes and insight competence in internal projects.

About The Job

Your daily tasks will be to:


Provide trends and insights on how consumers act and what driving forces, attitudes and values are of central importance for them to want to continue consuming TUI‚Äôs products.
Conducting consumer and customer analyzes with associated recommendations to identify new business opportunities.
Through regular brand tracking and ad hoc research, ensure that TUI‚Äôs marketing activities and communication provide the intended effect, strengthen our brand strategy and increase the preference of our brand.
Manage and disseminate relevant information, knowledge and data within the company in an easy-to-understand and developing way.
Manage updating of monthly reports.
Conduct own and assist in the implementation of research projects.
Support colleagues in gathering data from systems.



About You


3+ years of work experience from a similar role.
Experience of working with trend monitoring, questionnaire construction and analysis of data.
Experienced in extracting and processing data from various systems. Skills in Tableau and Qualtrics is an advantage.
Excellent analytical skills with an ability to visualize results in a neat way.
Previous insight competence acquired related to the Nordic consumer market.
University degree within relevant area.
Fluent in English and in one of the Scandinavian languages in speech and writing
Service-oriented and prestigeless.
Driven and self-motivated.
Good communicative and social skills.
Good prioritization and problem-solving ability.



About Our Offer


Great location and open space offices
Excellent career development opportunities
Fantastic holiday benefits including discounts
Online wellbeing and learning support
Fun and dynamic work culture



We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

We are looking forward to your application and meeting you!
Show more

Title: Business Translator - Data & Analytics
Description:
This is a Stockholm based position spanning for 1 year.

Join Our Team: Bridge the Gap Between Ideas and Action

At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.‚ÄØ‚ÄØCome join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

About the role:

As D&A Business Translator, you will work with marketing domain business analysts and experts to understands the strategic needs of the business, identify & structure opportunities that can be solved through data, analytics and AI. You will translate these needs into possible new use cases in both business and technical language.

Your Daily Challenges:


Analyze commercial, marketing performance, and consumer data.
Elicit key information using document analysis, requirements, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
Communicate and collaborate with teams to analyze information and functional requirements and deliver solutions from analytics artifacts to AI applications.
Collaborate within a Product Team, working alongside architects, data & visualization engineers, data scientists, Product Owners, and marketing subject matter experts/business analysts.
Establish the technical vision and evaluate tradeoffs between usability and performance requirements.
Aggregate existing data from Electrolux and external sources such as GA4, DV360, SA360, Meta, Qualtrics, eCommerce, and service systems.
Transpose hypotheses and methodologies into relevant metrics and applications.
Develop customized solutions with D&A Engineering and Data Science teams to link, store, locate, and retrieve data using the appropriate infrastructure and tools.


You are:


Bi-lingual: You understand both business and technical languages and naturally act as a translation bridge between the two. You can explain technical concepts in business-friendly language and vice-versa. You support the business users during UATs.
Excellent collaborator & communicator: You have a proven ability to form strong cross-functional relationships with varying business partners, promoting a strong sense of "we're all in it together."
Data Analytics: You are a critical thinker who is enterprising, curious, persistent, and strategic, with significant experience in analysis work and using various analytics tools.
Data driven: You leverage data naturally and drive optimization. You have a strong analytical mind with experience in coordinating analytics and data science projects and teams.
Agile: You are familiar with working in agile teams, have a sense of urgency, and can quickly adapt to different situations, understanding changes, and reacting confidently and decisively. You have a demonstrated ability to learn quickly and a hunger for continual learning.


Requirements:


Academic degree in (business) computer science or a comparable training
Sound understanding of systems integration concepts
Experience in analytics development and handling a wide range of analytical tools and applications (e.g. Power BI, Qlik products, SQL, Python, Databricks)
Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills.
Forward-looking working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of commitment
Ability to work in a multicultural environment
Fluent in English, any other language is a plus


The location:

This is a full-time, fixed-term position for one year, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).

At our Global Headquarters we have 60+ nationalities under the same roof, and we enjoy the look and feel of the office.

You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the common language.

Benefits highlights:


Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
Family-friends benefits
Insurance policy plan
Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Data Engineer

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Duration: 4 months+ ext.

Start Date: ASAP







Job responsibilities:




o Participate in various discovery workshops to understand the business objectives and goals

o Define minimum viable product (MVP) scope for the upcoming initiatives and outline future roadmap of enhancements and potential improvements

o Preparing functional to technical specifications, giving the needed instructions to the agile delivery team, testing the products results and ensuring a quality delivery according to the business requirements

o Drive the collaboration in development and rollout efforts for the new initiatives through the Data Architect, product teams, and actively engage in prototyping new solutions utilizing the clients Data Lake and Analytical solutions.

o Provide training and guidance to business key users and ensure successful adoption in day-to-day operations with final solution handover to support function




Experience and Skill Requirements:




‚Ä¢ 5 years+ involvement in delivering Analytics projects

‚Ä¢ Previous experience as functional consultant or an IT Business analyst with a well-rounded understanding for analytics, agile software development and business transformation.

‚Ä¢ Practical experience in analytics development with Microsoft ADLS, Databricks, SQL, PowerBI & Qlik

‚Ä¢ Excellent communicator with proven strong relationship building skills across varying levels of seniority

‚Ä¢ Strong planning, communication and presentation skills

‚Ä¢ Passionate about problem solving and solution design

‚Ä¢ Forward-looking working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of commitment

‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment




Language Requirements: Fluent in English, other European languages are a benefit




If you are interested, please contact Simran Navlani on snavlani@redglobal.com or apply here.

Thanks

Simran Navlani

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Company
PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do ‚Äì and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can design and maintain large scale data pipelines. An engineer who can identify, design, and implement solutions for optimizing data delivery.

Job Description:
Meet our team:

By joining Data Platform, you will be part of a great team powered by people from different regions of the world and working together on providing the best platform to collect, enrich and expose data for Zettle teams to make smarter and faster data-driven decisions.

Your way to impact:

On a more practical level, you will design and maintain large scale data pipelines. With that in mind, here you will get the opportunity to:


Play a role in building a new data pipeline on Google Cloud Platform.
Experiment fearlessly, take responsibilities, and grow your expertise to the next level.
Enable a data informed product development organization by delivering high quality data fast and easy to data users within the company.



In your day-to-day role:


You are interested in data modelling ensuring that timely updated, clean and accurate data is available to all teams at Zettle.
You are a true team player known for being reliable, curious and bold.
You gladly share your knowledge, experience and opinions while understanding and respecting that the last word comes from the team.
You make it fun and wouldn't mind playing OpenRA because that‚Äôs what we do as a team when we want to have fun.



What you need to bring:

In the Data Platform Team, we are mainly programming in Java and Python, while our stack also includes Kotlin, Airflow, Spark, Beam, BigQuery that is hosted on Google Cloud Platform. The infrastructure is defined in Terraform and we are using both continuous integration and deployment.


Working in cloud environments (GCP or AWS)
Strong software engineering fundamentals and backend development experience
Solid knowledge in an OOP language, preferably Java, Kotlin and Python
SQL and analytical databases such as BigQuery
Data processing frameworks such as Apache Beam
Airflow or other workflow management platforms



For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we‚Äôre committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can‚Äôt do this without our most important asset‚Äîyou. That‚Äôs why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

REQ ID R0113429

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What We Do At Qliro

At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both here in Sweden and the Nordics.

What Your Team Does

We're a data team responsible for the data platform that powers Qliro's Analytics and data producs, handling over 50 TB of data! We believe great work can be done anywhere, that's why we offer flexible remote work. Join us and leverage your data expertise to build high-impact data products that fuel business decisions and power our machine learning models serving millions of customers.

How you'll make a difference:


Wrangle massive datasets related to Payments.
Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for efficient data flow.
Champion data quality and ensure its accuracy for critical business decisions.
Utilize cutting-edge tools like AWS, Snowflake, GitLab, and dbt to build a robust data platform.
Partner with cross-functional teams (Product, Finance, Credit and Tech teams) to translate data into data products and building the foundation for Analytics.


What You Bring To The Team


You are highly experienced in the majority of our techstack, but most importantly in SQL, Python, dbt and Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouse)
You bring value to the business by using data, preferably within financial and/or related industries
You are logical and analytical minded and are able to communicate technical content to end users
Passionate about solving complex business problems by building data products with high quality and velocity
You are someone who continuously seeks improvements, enjoys learning new tools and techniques and having fun together as a data team.


Our stack:

Snowflake, dbt, Airflow, Docker, AWS & Tableau

Does this sound like your next role? What are you waiting for - apply now!

Title: Analyst Consultant - Risk Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You‚Äôll join our global Risk & Resilience Practice in one of our European offices and be part of the Risk Analytics team.‚ÄØ

Risk Analytics is the tech-enablement power engine of Risk & Resilience. We combine deep analytical and technical expertise with distinctive strategy and transformation capabilities to support clients in everything - from large-scale analytics programs to in-depth technical modelling exercises.

We develop and deploy leading-edge solutions incorporating the latest innovations in methodology and technology and maintain in-depth knowledge of regulatory developments. We convene leaders in the industry to build and share knowledge to drive long-term sustainable change in the practice of risk data and analytics.

We have over 18 years of expertise serving leading institutions across industries in the fields of model development, model advisory, model validation, and model risk management.

We are a diverse global community of world-class practitioners with a shared passion to build risk analytics capabilities that break new ground, transform industries, and shape markets. We solve real life business problems for our clients; work with us and you will learn from the best and have your voice heard from day one.

There is flexibility to hire at the Analyst or Senior Analyst level depending on candidate experience.

What You'll Do

As an Analyst Consultant in Risk Analytics, you will


Help clients to develop, refine and review their models using cutting-edge technology to better manage risk, assess market opportunities and create business benefits, across different areas of expertise.
Assess our clients‚Äô frameworks for model development and risk management across a variety of risk topics. This includes credit risk, market and trading risk, climate risk, financial crime and compliance and wider applications such as cyber‚ÄØand digital trust.
Analyze content and data, identify risk vectors, build prototypes, interpret results, find new solutions, derive conclusions, support clients to implement recommendations, and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value.
Be expected to communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to key client stakeholders‚ÄØ
Be able to establish connections between sophisticated modelling techniques and strategic decision-making processes. You will have exposure to a highly international environment as our client base is global‚ÄØ
Work on projects and exchange experiences with your colleagues which means you will face new intellectual challenges daily, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills, as well as your strategic consultancy toolkit


RiskandR

Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree required. Advanced quantitative degree (Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics/statistics, engineering, or financial engineering) would be a plus
2+ years of relevant experience in risk quantitative analysis/modelling to solve real world problems‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Experience across model lifecycle, including active participation in activities of development, implementation and/or testing of risk models (vendor or ‚Äúin-house‚Äù models)‚ÄØ
First experience in programming (beyond simple scripts) in a modern scientific language (e.g., Python, Matlab, R). Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB, Ignite) and SAS would be a strong plus‚ÄØ
Experience in one of the following machine learning / AI areas natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, graph-based techniques would be a strong plus‚ÄØ
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization‚ÄØ
Exceptional communication skills - especially around translating technical knowledge into forms that can be digested by leadership and non-technical project teams-, verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s)‚ÄØ
Willingness to travel‚ÄØ

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Did you know that we have 500 million online visitors every year? Join our Data & ML Platform team and help promote a more data-driven development!




Do you want to help us leverage the data from our 40M visits a month? Join our data journey and have an impact on Sweden's largest property portal. We need you to help us complete the transition from our current Data Warehouse into our new, full-fledged Data Platform. And then take it to the next level.




Hemnet is the largest property portal in Sweden, and as such, we handle vast amounts of data and events related to the use of our website and apps. We believe that we have only scratched the surface when it comes to turning this data into new products and analyses, for user and market benefit.




We are on an exciting journey to build a new Data Platform. We have several interesting challenges ahead of us before the new Data Platform is ready to serve all the data and events generated in the system, and cater to all of Hemnet‚Äôs needs for analytics, statistics, and all our data-driven product features. The main goals of the Data Platform are: All data in one place, and unified tracking.




Technology that we use includes AWS & GCP, Airbyte, BigQuery, dbt, and server-side GTM.




We see the need to strengthen our team of Data Engineers. We are now looking for a seasoned Data Engineer with solid knowledge from working with large amounts of data and events, building aggregation pipelines, and serving data to products and users from a Data Warehouse or a Data Platform.




The Data Engineers at Hemnet are part of the Data and ML Platform team, which has an overall responsibility for supporting the whole organization with stable and performant platforms for data and MLOps, as well as development and training of ML models. We see great opportunities ahead leveraging our vast data sources to both broaden and deepen our analytics department, and to build new data-driven products to serve our customers.




What we offer

We have a beautiful office next to H√∂torget and a hybrid-remote work setup (not fully remote), offering flexibility and balance. Enjoy 30 days of holiday plus 4 YOLO days, paid workouts, running classes/races, and flexible working hours. We provide comprehensive benefits to ensure you feel safe and supported, including pension benefits, parental leave top-up, and health insurance. Here‚Äôs our full benefit package üëà.




Our culture of sharing includes lab weeks twice a year, Friday demos, dev brekkies, and brown bags. Hemnet is a place where you can be yourself and have fun with others. We actively encourage you to explore and share your other passions ‚Äì whether it's producing music, painting, or playing with clay.




Join us in crafting digital products that make a real impact!

Show more

Title: Consultant - Data & Process Analytics
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

We're Celonis, the global leading Process Mining software company and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us as Consultant.

The Role:

As a Consultant in our delivery organization, you are part of our agile project teams to accelerate our customers‚Äô digital transformation and drive Celonis‚Äô international expansion. To generate high-value use cases, you work closely with our customers. You perform data transformations, develop analyses and derive business cases. You develop data-driven process insights and actions. You implement the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.

The work you‚Äôll do:


Initiate:
Play a key role in the Celonis implementation project to ensure the optimal solution to tackle the customer‚Äôs pain points
Design innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customer‚Äôs processes transparent
Use our Celonis technology to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes, always in close collaboration with the customer

Implement:


Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
Quantify the business and financial potential and present the findings to the management
Implement our Process Automation technology to speed up the customer‚Äôs processes, to drive value and to improve the process conformance rate


Adopt:


Implement the most relevant KPIs measuring the customer‚Äôs success
Ensure the enablement of the customer to continuously improve processes
Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen


The qualifications you need:


Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
You are knowledgeable of data related languages (SQL required, other programming languages such as Python are a plus...)
Strong communication skills in Swedish/Danish and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner
You search for a job with a steep learning curve in order to think outside the box and to continuously broaden your knowledge
Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program


What Celonis can offer you:


The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


About Us

Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Data Engineer

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Duration: 4 months+ ext.

Start Date: ASAP







Job responsibilities:




o Participate in various discovery workshops to understand the business objectives and goals

o Define minimum viable product (MVP) scope for the upcoming initiatives and outline future roadmap of enhancements and potential improvements

o Preparing functional to technical specifications, giving the needed instructions to the agile delivery team, testing the products results and ensuring a quality delivery according to the business requirements

o Drive the collaboration in development and rollout efforts for the new initiatives through the Data Architect, product teams, and actively engage in prototyping new solutions utilizing the clients Data Lake and Analytical solutions.

o Provide training and guidance to business key users and ensure successful adoption in day-to-day operations with final solution handover to support function




Experience and Skill Requirements:




‚Ä¢ 5 years+ involvement in delivering Analytics projects

‚Ä¢ Previous experience as functional consultant or an IT Business analyst with a well-rounded understanding for analytics, agile software development and business transformation.

‚Ä¢ Practical experience in analytics development with Microsoft ADLS, Databricks, SQL, PowerBI & Qlik

‚Ä¢ Excellent communicator with proven strong relationship building skills across varying levels of seniority

‚Ä¢ Strong planning, communication and presentation skills

‚Ä¢ Passionate about problem solving and solution design

‚Ä¢ Forward-looking working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of commitment

‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment




Language Requirements: Fluent in English, other European languages are a benefit




If you are interested, please contact Simran Navlani on snavlani@redglobal.com or apply here.

Thanks

Simran Navlani

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Engineer. The successful candidate will work on developing and maintaining our data architecture to support various initiatives, ensuring data quality, and adopting data mesh capabilities. This role is crucial to our One Data Foundation Initiative and other prioritized projects like BTI-292, BTI-146, BTI-147, and BTI-260.




Key Responsibilities:

Development of SADP and IDPs: Create and manage scalable and efficient data pipelines and infrastructure.
Ensuring Data Quality: Implement data quality checks and processes to maintain high data standards.
Adopting Data Mesh Capabilities: Integrate and support data mesh architecture to enhance our data ecosystem.




Required Technical Skills:

Strong GCP Skills: Proficient with Google Cloud Platform services, understanding their use cases and cost implications.
Data Warehouse Concepts: Expertise in data warehousing, SQL, and related concepts.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python.
Data Build Tool (DBT): Experience with DBT for data transformation.
Infrastructure as Code: Knowledge of Terraform for infrastructure management.




Leadership/Experience Level:

Mid Senior to Senior Data Engineer: We are open to evaluating both mid-level and senior candidates to find the best fit for our client.




Required Cloud Certification:

Google Cloud or other Cloud Engineering Certification: Must possess relevant cloud certifications.

Show more

Title: Consumer Insight Specialist
Description:
We are looking for you, with a strong interest in trend monitoring, analysis and with a business drive, who wants to take on the position of Consumer Insight Specialist within the Nordic commercial team in Stockholm. If you also have experience of describing what drives the consumer demand and are used to conducting surveys, then this is the role for you!

As Consumer Insight Analyst, you have a good ability to transform data into guiding consumer insights. You are a specialist in your field but enjoy collaborating with different interfaces and constellations. You are curious and interested in understanding consumers and the world around you. You are a good listener but also have the ability to take your own initiatives and push forward within your areas of responsibility. You like to familiarize yourself with complex contexts and with an open mind find solutions. You have a high analytical ability and like to convey insights and enthuse in a credible way. With responsibility for handling and updating consumer and customer data, you take care of the internal reporting to the organization. Furthermore, you support the Nordic organization with ad hoc analyzes and insight competence in internal projects.

About The Job

Your daily tasks will be to:


Provide trends and insights on how consumers act and what driving forces, attitudes and values are of central importance for them to want to continue consuming TUI‚Äôs products.
Conducting consumer and customer analyzes with associated recommendations to identify new business opportunities.
Through regular brand tracking and ad hoc research, ensure that TUI‚Äôs marketing activities and communication provide the intended effect, strengthen our brand strategy and increase the preference of our brand.
Manage and disseminate relevant information, knowledge and data within the company in an easy-to-understand and developing way.
Manage updating of monthly reports.
Conduct own and assist in the implementation of research projects.
Support colleagues in gathering data from systems.



About You


3+ years of work experience from a similar role.
Experience of working with trend monitoring, questionnaire construction and analysis of data.
Experienced in extracting and processing data from various systems. Skills in Tableau and Qualtrics is an advantage.
Excellent analytical skills with an ability to visualize results in a neat way.
Previous insight competence acquired related to the Nordic consumer market.
University degree within relevant area.
Fluent in English and in one of the Scandinavian languages in speech and writing
Service-oriented and prestigeless.
Driven and self-motivated.
Good communicative and social skills.
Good prioritization and problem-solving ability.



About Our Offer


Great location and open space offices
Excellent career development opportunities
Fantastic holiday benefits including discounts
Online wellbeing and learning support
Fun and dynamic work culture



We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

We are looking forward to your application and meeting you!
Show more

Title: Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data | SEB, Stockholm
Description:
The industry of Banking is changing rapidly. We are going through changes in the cash management area with new competitors, technological development and infrastructure upgrades.

Do you want to join a professional and passionate team that is in the process of further developing the analytical capabilities within SEB Corporate Banking and beyond? Customer expectations in the digital era is putting new requirements on our existing and future data driven advisory products. In this transition we aim to automate, simplify and implement self-service advanced analytics in all areas. We are now looking for a Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data . As part of our Google Cloud migration journey, you will help define account data products that support our reporting and analytics use cases.

About the role:

As a Data Steward, you will champion data quality, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance for our account data and products. You'll develop and implement innovative data governance frameworks and best practices. By collaborating closely with stakeholders across departments, you'll define and refine data requirements and standards, driving powerful analytics initiatives and turning raw data into actionable insights. Monitoring key data quality metrics and KPIs, you will ensure continuous improvement and swiftly resolve any data discrepancies. Additionally, you'll play a pivotal role in our Google Cloud migration journey, defining account data products to enhance our reporting and analytics capabilities in cloud. To your support you will work in close collaboration with the information architects and account product specialists to reach our desired state of defined account products, account data products and schemas.

The role reports to the Head of Data and Analytics within Cash Management. We are part of Corporate Banking, LC&FI and our tasks and responsibility often span across the SEB Group.

As a Data Steward and Account Data Specialist you will be responsible for:


Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with regulatory and internal standards.
Collaborating with stakeholders to define data requirements and standards for account data products.
Monitoring and report on data quality metrics and KPIs.
Identifying and resolve data-related issues and discrepancies.
Supporting reporting and data analytics initiatives to drive insights and business decisions.
Continuously improve data management processes and tools.
Collaborating with other data stewards, information architects, analysts, data owners, and our tech development teams.


To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


Documented university degree or equivalent within areas such as finance, IT or engineering.
A curious mindset and are a positive team player.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Deep understanding of data quality principles and best practices.
An attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
The ability to manage your time & prioritize.
Account product knowledge.
The ability to balance between reactive and strategic work.
Track record in data management, data stewardship, or data governance within the banking sector.
Data modelling knowledge, which is considered a bonus.


What we offer:

We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual‚Äôs career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:


Work-life balance with the principle of office first.
Attractive compensation and benefits.
Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
Excellent office environment.
Agile and modern ways of working.
Deliver world-class service to customers.


Do you want to be part of SEB?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August 20th 2024. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the role. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Eln√§s, jonatan.elnas@seb.se .

Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual during the summer due to the holidays.

Learn more about working at SEB: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
Show more
HTML:
The industry of Banking is changing rapidly. We are going through changes in the cash management area with new competitors, technological development and infrastructure upgrades.

Do you want to join a professional and passionate team that is in the process of further developing the analytical capabilities within SEB Corporate Banking and beyond? Customer expectations in the digital era is putting new requirements on our existing and future data driven advisory products. In this transition we aim to automate, simplify and implement self-service advanced analytics in all areas. We are now looking for a Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data . As part of our Google Cloud migration journey, you will help define account data products that support our reporting and analytics use cases.

About the role:

As a Data Steward, you will champion data quality, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance for our account data and products. You'll develop and implement innovative data governance frameworks and best practices. By collaborating closely with stakeholders across departments, you'll define and refine data requirements and standards, driving powerful analytics initiatives and turning raw data into actionable insights. Monitoring key data quality metrics and KPIs, you will ensure continuous improvement and swiftly resolve any data discrepancies. Additionally, you'll play a pivotal role in our Google Cloud migration journey, defining account data products to enhance our reporting and analytics capabilities in cloud. To your support you will work in close collaboration with the information architects and account product specialists to reach our desired state of defined account products, account data products and schemas.

The role reports to the Head of Data and Analytics within Cash Management. We are part of Corporate Banking, LC&FI and our tasks and responsibility often span across the SEB Group.

As a Data Steward and Account Data Specialist you will be responsible for:

  • Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with regulatory and internal standards.
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to define data requirements and standards for account data products.
  • Monitoring and report on data quality metrics and KPIs.
  • Identifying and resolve data-related issues and discrepancies.
  • Supporting reporting and data analytics initiatives to drive insights and business decisions.
  • Continuously improve data management processes and tools.
  • Collaborating with other data stewards, information architects, analysts, data owners, and our tech development teams.

To thrive in this role, we believe you have:

  • Documented university degree or equivalent within areas such as finance, IT or engineering.
  • A curious mindset and are a positive team player.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  • Deep understanding of data quality principles and best practices.
  • An attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
  • The ability to manage your time & prioritize.
  • Account product knowledge.
  • The ability to balance between reactive and strategic work.
  • Track record in data management, data stewardship, or data governance within the banking sector.
  • Data modelling knowledge, which is considered a bonus.

What we offer:

We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual‚Äôs career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:

  • Work-life balance with the principle of office first.
  • Attractive compensation and benefits.
  • Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
  • Excellent office environment.
  • Agile and modern ways of working.
  • Deliver world-class service to customers.

Do you want to be part of SEB?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August 20th 2024. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the role. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Eln√§s, jonatan.elnas@seb.se .

Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual during the summer due to the holidays.

Learn more about working at SEB: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Title: Finance Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description:
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. Within TUI Group, TUI Airline regroups all airline activities across UK, Nordics, Belgium, The Netherlands, Germany, Spain, Morocco, France, and the Dutch Antilles. TUI Airline Finance is a function within our airline organisation responsible for supporting the newly restructured TUI Airline Board in delivering against the strategic agenda and managing our continued transformation to a functionally led business with a single-airline mind-set.

As Finance Business Intelligence Analyst, you will project manage high profile financial and strategic projects across five European Airlines with a cost base of ‚Ç¨4bn, through scoping business and technical requirements, model development, database management and BI analysis. You will develop robust financial databases and key processes to enable project development, implementation and monitoring phases; providing proportionate levels of control in a highly technical team.

The individual will support finance by liaising with Data Science to provide extraction and transformation of data through a centralised data warehouse, using a variety of software tools to provide the best experience for the end user.

About The Job

As Finance Business Intelligence Analyst, you‚Äôll be responsible for:


Working with subject matter experts across airline finance to manage analytics projects from start to finish, gathering and transforming data sources; creating bespoke financial models, which are automated where possible, and versatile to cope with extensive scenario testing
Liaise and challenge stakeholders to understand business requirements to design and build business appropriate solutions to support
Construct a detailed roadmap of all analytics and reporting requests across Airline Finance, giving priority to projects with the biggest financial and efficiency savings.
Provide regular input & challenge to the Senior Leadership Team on progress versus roadmap targets, prioritisation of projects and financial savings achieved
Deliver financial savings through understanding the commercial application of data insights to drive business decisions, prioritising projects with the biggest potential and proactively identifying new opportunities.
Create bespoke financial models and databases using data management, transformation, and automation, ensuring versatility to cope with extensive business scenarios
Maintain the airline finance data lake, ensuring appropriate controls are in place
Build, deploy, and maintain reports to support the TUI airline budget process and cost base of ‚Ç¨4bn. Ensuring these are accurate, effective, and understood by the business users and are in line with company development and design standards
Build processes that enable non-technical users to load data sources that update bespoke built models within a software platform
Building interactive, self-serve dashboards in Tableau and provide training to the business on how to use
Provide ongoing and proactive quality assurance checks
Continuously seek improvements to underlying processes and drive efficiency into the team



About You

Experience of relational databases and ETL processes


Advanced user of SQL.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
A minimum of 2 years industry experience in a Business Intelligence role
experience in data visualization (Tableau or similar)
Proven track record of using data to implement change
Javascript knowledge (desirable)
Comfortable communicating complex insights to non-technical stakeholders at all levels
Ability to prioritize and structure own workload, managing stakeholder expectations and timelines
Role requires strong business English, both spoken and written, and may involve some international travel



About Our Offer


Working in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.
Mobile working, flexible working hours and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go.
Development and career opportunities: We promote the potential of our employees with a wide range of digital training opportunities and international career opportunities.
Personal benefits: We offer attractive remuneration, generous travel benefits, extensive health & wellbeing offers and much more.



At TUI, we know people are as diverse as the destinations we send our customers to.We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit our Smile page Click here

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Kambi

Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world‚Äôs leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

About Tzeract:

Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.

To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/

Role Overview:

We're seeking a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for sports and a keen eye for statistics to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow and integrity of large-scale sports data sets. You will work closely with our data scientists and developers, turning complex data into actionable insights that drive our AI algorithms.

Responsibilities:



Develop and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines for real-time and historical sports data ingestion, processing, and analysis using Python and AWS services.
Implement and manage AWS cloud-based solutions to ensure high availability, performance, and security of our data infrastructure.
Collaborate with data scientists to understand data requirements for AI model development and provide the necessary data engineering support.
Apply your expertise in statistics and data analysis to enhance data quality and the effectiveness of our AI algorithms.
Monitor data pipelines and systems performance, troubleshoot data issues, and implement optimizations.
Stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies in data engineering and sports analytics to continuously improve our data systems.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong proficiency in Python.
Extensive experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Redshift) and managing cloud-based data infrastructure.
Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies is highly desirable.
A good eye for statistics and experience in statistical modeling or analysis.
Passion for sports and sports data analysis is a big plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.



Why Join Us:



Be part of a cutting-edge project that's shaping the future of sports betting.
Work in an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach.
Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.
Engage in continuous learning and growth opportunities within an ambitious tech startup.



How to Apply:

Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, and any relevant portfolio links or GitHub repository to us. Please include "Data Engineer Application" in the subject line.

We're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi
